intro: Aerva transvaalensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showing adaptations to drought conditions. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Aerva transvaalensis is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
